overviewPoints.sectionPara: The job results page was cluttered and hard to navigate, especially on mobile. Filters were fragmented, listings were crowded, and key content like featured jobs and tools was often overlooked.

We moved to a single-column job layout with a persistent sidebar for filters and tools. Search and filter actions were simplified, and strategic callouts—top-matching jobs, premium ads, and career tools—were integrated without disrupting flow, making the experience cleaner and more engaging.

The original job details page was functional but lacked visual clarity and modern design. Mobile users faced duplicate CTAs, confusing workflows, and extra steps to sign up for job alerts, while the “Similar Jobs” section was unstructured, reducing engagement and discoverability.

We streamlined the layout, removed redundant CTAs, and introduced a top search bar for easy navigation. An in-line, single-step email sign-up simplified alerts, while the “Similar Jobs” section and a new “Key Facts” summary improved content hierarchy and readability. These changes delivered a cleaner, more engaging, and mobile-friendly experience that increased usability and conversions.

The previous company pages were generic, visually uninspiring, and failed to reflect each employer's brand. Users struggled to explore companies, and employers had limited ways to showcase culture, values, or open roles.

We introduced fully customisable landing pages with modular sections for storytelling, imagery, and values, along with dedicated job results pages. The new design improved engagement, allowed companies to highlight their uniqueness, and made it easier for jobseekers to discover meaningful opportunities.

Launching multiple industry-specific job sites was complex, as each needed a distinct visual identity while maintaining consistent structure and UX. Without a scalable system, rolling out new sites was time-consuming and error-prone.

We created a unified HTML framework with shared structure and scalable CSS theming, allowing each site to have unique branding, icons, and colour palettes. The result was a family of visually distinct, responsive, SEO-friendly platforms that could be deployed efficiently and maintained consistently.

Users lacked a clear way to explore career paths aligned with their personality and interests. The platform needed a fun, intuitive experience that provided personalised guidance while integrating with job listings and certificates.

We designed an interactive, personality-based quiz that generates unique DNA codes and tailored job recommendations. A dashboard lets users view results and access jobs, while downloadable certificates and bespoke branding create an engaging, mobile-friendly experience that connects users to real career opportunities.

A sleek, dark-themed homepage and full brand refresh for Disrupted Cloud, showcasing its suite of niche job sites and performance-driven advertising solution, Lightning Clicks. Bold visuals, interactive site previews, and modular design patterns make the platform engaging, modern, and mobile-ready.

Ranger Game is a fun, interactive text adventure inspired by classic space games and choose-your-own-path storytelling. Players navigate a mission-based journey, making decisions that impact outcomes, exploring multiple endings, and engaging with custom illustrations, sound effects, and a dynamic UI. Designed for both desktop and mobile, the game combines narrative, visuals, and interactivity for a truly immersive experience.
